message.entry: Cannot save your preferences. The results folder is read-only.
Apply new preferences and close dialog box
Close dialog box without applying new preferences

Review source code and monitor project metrics in an intuitive web interface that is integrated with your bug tracking tool.
Log in through a web browser to begin your collaborative review process.
An HTTP protocol is set in the Polyspace Access URL but a client certificate is defined.\nPlease change the protocol to HTTPS or clear the client keystore settings.
The Polyspace Access URL must have a protocol, host name and port number:\n https://<host>:<port> or http://<host>:<port>
Enter the Polyspace Access URL using form http[s]://<host>:<port> :
Enter full path to client keystore file :
Job scheduler host name (or Cluster Profile name):
Enter Cluster Profile name if you use the Cluster Profile Manager to create a profile.
For changes to the MATLAB Parallel Server cluster configuration to take effect, you must restart Polyspace.
The job scheduler host name cannot be empty.
The parallel computing username cannot be empty.
Specify 3rd party schedulers or advanced properties for the default MATLAB Job Scheduler.
Use the following server and port:
The server name "localhost" can be used if the server is the local machine.
The remote server and port number fields cannot be empty.
Invalid remote server name: space characters are not allowed.
Invalid port number: an integer value is required.
Port number must lie in the range 0-65535.
Download results to the project folder
If no project folder exists, download to:
The download folder cannot be empty.

Specifies the character encoding used by the operating system on which the source file was created.
This allows you to view source files created on an operating system that uses different character encoding than the current system.

Select the character encoding that you want to use.
Note: You must restart Polyspace to use the new character encoding settings.
Select current operating system character encoding: {0}
For the change in the character encoding to take effect, you must restart Polyspace.\n\n Note: Selecting an invalid character encoding may prevent results from being opened.

Emacs example:
Text Editor (Specify full path): /usr/bin/emacs
Arguments: +$LINE:$COLUMN $FILE

Wordpad example:
Text Editor (Specify full path): C:\\Program Files\\Windows NT\\Accessories\\wordpad.exe
Arguments: $FILE
The macros $FILE, $LINE, and $COLUMN can be used.
Specify the full path to a graphical text editor.
Specify the command line arguments for the text editor.
Select an IDE to edit files
Always ask me before saving files
If you do not select this check box your files will be saved automatically when you run Polyspace.

When adding new items to your Polyspace Tools menu, you may use the variables below in execution commands.
For example, to allow viewing of the current preprocessed file, you can specify the command WordPad.exe "$EXPANDED_SOURCE_FILE"
Path to verification command that generated current results
Path to current displayed source file
Name of current selected file (package for Ada)
Path to the current Polyspace product
Warning: "{0}" is not a valid name for a Tools menu item
Specify menu item and corresponding command
Items that Tools menu will display
Unix command executed when menu item is selected

Execute command associated with {0}.
To modify item, use Tools Menu tab in Polyspace Preferences dialog box.
Modifying the Justified state has no impact on existing results.
Select if you want this status to appear as Done in the Dashboard
Select if you want this status to appear as Done in the Polyspace Access web interface.
Status "{0}" already exists. Choose another name.
Do you want to add "{0}" to the list of user statuses?
Scope is currently in use.\nIt can not be removed.
• For Ada use AUTO for automatic selection
Invalid entry.\nValue must be between 0 and 9999 or "ALL" or "AUTO".

Invalid entry.
Value must be between 0 and 100.
Invalid entry.\nCharacters '[',']','=' and ',' are not allowed.

"{0}" is not a valid scope name.
A scope name must NOT : 
 - Have the same name as a predefined scope.
 - Start with white spaces,
 - Contain only white spaces,
 - Contain one of the following forbidden characters: '*' '/' '' '<' '>' '?' '"' ':' or '|'

Number of orange checks to display
Enter 1-9999 or ‘ALL’. If you leave blank, all checks are displayed.
Percentage of green and justified orange checks to obtain
Manage Show menu on Results List
Your scope controls the orange checks displayed in Results List

Specify thresholds for your metrics.
If a metric violates the threshold, the metric result is flagged in red.
Enter 0-9999. If you leave blank, no limits apply to the metric.
Note: The threshold number is an upper limit unless otherwise noted.
Your scope controls the defects you review
Display limits cannot be specified for global variables
Invalid value. Value must be between 1 and 100.
Invalid value. Value must be between 1 and 9999 or "ALL" or empty.
Invalid value. Value must be between 0 and 9999 or empty.
Unsupported configuration file. The file {0} is not for the {1} product.
The file {0} is not a review preference file.

Percentage of green and orange checks to display.
First, green checks are considered.
If they do not make up the percentage, orange checks are displayed.
Enter a percentage. If you leave blank, all checks are displayed.

Percentage of defects to review.
The percentage is calculated as: Defect justified / Total Defects
Enter a percentage. If you leave blank, all defects are displayed.
The file {0} is an empty file.
Please correct error(s) on the Review Scope tab.

Number of defects to review
Enter 1-9999 or ‘ALL’. If you leave blank, all defects are displayed.
Load scope from existing configuration file
Do you want to save your changes in scope {0}?
Remove this scope from the list
Threshold for this code metric is a lower limit.
Results without code metrics and global variables
Red, gray and critical orange checks
Scope {0} already exists.\nDo you want to replace it?
Review scope location: {0} does not exist, please select a new folder.

Numbers converted to percentage. Some percentages may not be valid.
NOTE: The conversion will change number of results displayed.

Percentage converted to numbers.
NOTE: The conversion will change number of results displayed.
Show line number in Source Code
Autocomplete on Results List or Details is case sensitive
Warn me when results are filtered in Results List

Select this option if you want to be warned about previously applied filters in Results List.
For instance, the warning shows when you select an orange source and all related orange checks are not displayed due to active filters.

entry.note: checkbox label, result means analysis result

message.entry: Always ask me when a new result is available
For changes to the GUI font size to take effect, you must restart Polyspace.
Maximum number of coding rule violations loaded in the UI
Leave blank to use the module folder as the parent results folder
Leave blank to use the project folder as the parent results folder
Parent result folder location: {0} does not exist. Select an existing location.
Path for default project location: {0} does not exist. Select an existing location.
Folder {0} does not exist. Select a new folder.
File {0} does not exist. Select a new file.
Add a subfolder using the project name
Note: Result folder names will be automatically prefixed by BF or CP for Bug Finder analysis or Code Prover verification respectively
Result folder prefix cannot contain the following characters: "/\'*+=.?<>:|.
A results folder prefix must be given.
For unit by unit verification, Compilation Assistant is automatically disabled.
Note: If any file does not compile, the Compilation Assistant stops the analysis and provides possible solutions.
Automatically import comments from last verification.
Save preferences and close the dialog
Close the dialog without saving the preferences
Browse for your preferred web browser
Browse for your preferred web browser
Please specify your preferred web browser in the Preferences.
Set Polyspace Platform as default user interface for static analysis
Select the box below to set Polyspace Platform as your default user interface. You can revert your choice at any time from the Polyspace Platform Preferences window.
Improve Polyspace by sending user experience information to MathWorks
